survey.title: Encuesta de Clima Escolar, Bullying y Cyberbullying_TECH4ZERO_MX
survey.population: Educación secundaria y media superior (12-18 años), México
references: OBVQ-R: Olweus (1996); Gaete et al. (2021); Resett et al. (2021)
ECIP-Q: Ortega-Ruiz et al. (2016, 2023); Romera et al. (2018)
Contexto MX: INEGI (2017); Encuesta Mejoredu (2024); Lucio López & Gómez Triana (2020)
Teoría: Bronfenbrenner (1979); Bandura (1997); Cohen & Wills (1985); Salmivalli et al. (1996)
mexico_adaptations: Plataformas digitales mexicanas: WhatsApp, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok — ítems 34-39
Dejar en visto como exclusión digital — ítems 36, 39
Transporte escolar: camión, combi, metro — ítem 44
Casa de compañeros para tareas — ítem 45
Impacto psicológico y consideración de ayuda profesional — ítems 52-55
Líneas de ayuda: Línea de la Vida 800 911 2000, Locatel 5658 1111
survey.admin_note: Validar localmente antes de uso en decisiones de alta consecuencia. Recomendado: AFC + Alpha de Cronbach por dimensión.
changelog: v3 (JSON): Built from authoritative PDF TECH4ZERO-MX v1.0.
v3: Aligned all 55 questions, 9 sections, construct/construct_role/scale_type/score_direction fields.
v3: Cyberbullying split into cybervictimizacion (Q34-36) and cyberagresion (Q37-39).
v3: All scales unified to 0-4 (frequency_0_4 or likert_0_4). No more ordinal_AD or frequency_0_3.
v3: Added section, section_name, reference, notes fields per question.
v3: Added score_direction per question (higher_means_more_risk vs higher_means_more_protective).
v3: Added published_alpha, threshold values, and analytics_use notes to constructs block.
v3: Global screener items (Q24, Q33) flagged to exclude from Cronbach alpha.
v3: Ecology section flagged as conditional (only for victims).

clima_docente.reference: ZERO-R Roland (2000, 2011); validated Stavanger trials (40-50% bullying reduction)

normas_grupo.reference: Bandura (1997); Roland & Galloway (2004); Salmivalli et al. (1996)
normas_grupo.note: Item 15 (zero_normas_intervencion_activa) measures behavior, not perception — consider separate subscale

victimizacion.alpha_computable_note: Exclude zero_victim_general (Q24 — global screener) from alpha calculation
victimizacion.reference: OBVQ-R Olweus (1996); Gaete et al. (2021) CFI>.94 RMSEA<.08 alpha=.90-.95

perpetracion.alpha_computable_note: Exclude zero_agresor_general (Q33 — global screener) from alpha calculation
perpetracion.reference: OBVQ-R Olweus (1996); Resett et al. (2021) alpha=.81-.95
perpetracion.note: Social desirability bias inherent to self-report of aggression (Roland, 1993)

cybervictimizacion.reference: ECIP-Q Ortega-Ruiz et al. (2016); EBCIP-QB (2023) CFI>.98 RMSEA<.05 alpha>.80

cyberagresion.reference: ECIP-Q Ortega-Ruiz et al. (2016); Romera et al. (2018)

ecologia_espacios.reference: Bronfenbrenner (1979); Astor et al. (2004); Roland (2000); Ortega-Ruiz (2016)
ecologia_espacios.note: Conditional section — only answered by students who reported victimization (Q16-24) or cyberbullying (Q34-36). Treat missing as 'not applicable', not as zero.
ecologia_espacios.analytics_use: Rank locations by mean score to identify hotspots

apoyo_institucional.reference: ZERO-R Roland (2000); Cohen & Wills (1985); Encuesta Mejoredu (2024)
apoyo_institucional.note: Low scores = silence flag risk. Cross-reference with victimizacion scores.

impacto.reference: UAEMex (2012); Lucio López & Gómez Triana (2020); Encuesta Mejoredu (2024)
impacto.note: Only meaningful for students who reported victimization. Consider filtering denominator.
